storyInfo: Swire shares a conversation with Wei Yenwu before she is promoted to Chief of the Special Inspection Unit.

attributes.content: Come in.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Hello, Master Wei.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Take a seat.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Officer Swire, there is something we must discuss.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Oh? Well, that's a new one. We've never had a discussion, just the two of us, have we?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: You might want to get used to it, then.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: So Officer Ch'en isn't coming back?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: No, she isn't.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: There are a lot of superintendents in the L.G.D. Why me? The things Officer Ch'en did, I might not...
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: You needn't do what 'Officer Ch'en did.' She was never the ideal choice to lead the Special Inspection Unit.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Master Wei? Just because Officer Ch'en is gone doesn't mean you're free to speak ill of her.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: I don't mean to speak ill. However, Officer Ch'en's strongest merit is her sense of justice, and that is also her greatest weakness. Her position called for more than a sense of justice.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Did it? Hm... Let me think... What else could you expect from me?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Good relationships stakeholding factions? A talent for command? A new face from the next generation? A bad relationship with Officer Ch'en? You wouldn't be after my family, right?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: You speak your mind, Swire.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: I've never been one to beat around the bush. I'm not my grandfather, Master Wei.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: And here I thought you'd avoid the word 'Grandfather.'
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: There was a time when I did, though I've since gotten used to it. He casts a long shadow in the L.G.D., and there's no running from the name 'Adams Schwire' as long as I live here.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Hah... I can't recall hearing an ordinary Lungmenite say his name. Perhaps it's not Lungmen that can't run from it, Officer Swire. It's you who can't escape the name.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Let's cut to the chase, Master Wei.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: I know the current L.G.D. Commissioner is one of his lackeys, no matter how solid his relationship with you. I also know that the longer my grandfather stays in his sickbed, the more uncertain things get.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: My family has had its differences with you, even before my grandfather got sick, but we always knew that the Corporate Union and Lungmen should and must coexist.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Now that my grandfather has been bedridden for fourteen years and counting, though, things have gotten far too chaotic and stupid with the men supposed to carry out his will.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: If they continue this way, what will become of the relationship between the Schwires and Lungmen by the time he finally shuffles off his mortal coil? This is a problem you have to face, Master Wei, just as the L.G.D. must.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: And maybe... It's one that I have to face too.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Am I right?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: I think I just saw Adams in you, young lady.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: That's a provocation, Master Wei. I resent the idea that anyone would see a single trace of him in me.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: My apologies. It was not my intention to provoke.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Fair enough. It seems to me you might have a slight misunderstanding about the relationships in my family... I'm not sure exactly how you think we get along with each other.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: If you don't want to go into the details, forget I ever said anything.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: No... It's alright.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: I've been thinking I might have to talk to you about this sooner or later, if I ended up taking over for Ch'en.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Waaaahhh...
attributes.name: Young Swire

attributes.content: Shh, shh... Beatrix, don't cry...
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: *Whimpers*... But Daddy... They were mean to me...
attributes.name: Young Swire

attributes.content: Shh... Grandpa is still home. Don't disturb him...
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: *Waaahhh... Uwargh-wah-hh!
attributes.name: Young Swire

attributes.content: I told you to stop crying! You don't want to disturb him!
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: A loud slap.
Is something the matter? Master Schwire said he heard a commotion.
attributes.name: Adams Schwire's Secretary

attributes.content: No, not at all. I was just taking Beatrix! Awfully, terribly sorry, sir. She did not mean to disturb Father.
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: Childhood memories tend to be blurry, and they say that if you have one that's particularly clear, it must've had a profound impact on your personality.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: So then, if I remember this so vividly even now, does that mean it was the first time I truly came to 'know' my grandfather?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: If my memory serves me right, your father is Adams's oldest son, and your grandfather had high hopes for him in his younger years... Hoh... Indeed, that's just like Adams.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: It doesn't seem like you grew up in the same kind of environment he did, though.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: My parents moved out of the place many years ago, after all. I could count the number of times I've met my grandfather on one hand. When he wasn't around, my parents treated me well.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Though... in another sense... I have always lived in his shadow.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: 'Don't do that, Grandpa said.' 'Don't play with them. Grandpa wouldn't like it.' —All the things I wasn't allowed to do when I was little, they were all because of 'Grandpa's wishes.'
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: —Not that I ever listened to him much.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: I cried, I got angry. I even asked, 'Why am I not allowed, just because Grandpa wouldn't be happy about it?' My parents were never able to give me a reason, but I could tell. They were much more afraid of him than I ever was.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: They weren't even trying to get on my grandfather's good side. They were just afraid of making him angry.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: In the end, my grandfather was the thing I feared most at the time. He was like... just like a monster that ends up killing the heroes in a B movie.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Who would show their child something like that?
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: I saw one once, and it kept me up all night. When I told my parents, '*Sobs* That ghost's scarier than Grandpa—' I got an earful from my father.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Then, I started to think: Oh, so Grandpa's actually scarier.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: It doesn't sound so bad just listening to the story, does it? Believe me, though. It wasn't easy to live through. There was a time when I thought of 'angering Grandfather' as the red line that could never be crossed.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: But some time after that...
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Over here!
attributes.name: Nameless Lungmen Policeman

attributes.content: The hostage is safe! Move in!
attributes.name: Nameless Lungmen Policeman

attributes.content: Little girl, are you okay?
attributes.name: Nameless Lungmen Policeman

attributes.content: Contact! It's the kidnapper! Requesting backup!
attributes.name: Lungmen Policeman

attributes.content: 10-4! I'll bring the girl out first!
attributes.name: Nameless Lungmen Policeman

attributes.content: Yes... I'm okay.
attributes.name: Young Swire

attributes.content: Master Wei, I'm sure you've figured out by now that it was then I decided to become a police officer. I'm sure you've also figured out that...
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Another loud slap.
Daddy...?
attributes.name: Young Swire

attributes.content: Sorry, Beatrix, I should not have slapped you, but... How could you? You stand to inherit everything! How could you say you want to join the police?
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: Father... Father will be furious when he finds out about this! You must abandon this idea!
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: Hmm...
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: I was actually baffled. You see, my cousin had just told me a few months prior that he was the first in line to take over.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: But when he said it, something felt off to me.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: The heir to the Schwire family fortune... Shouldn't that be...?
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Correct, neither me nor my cousin. It should have been my father.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: This is one of those questions that I could never wrap my head around when I was a kid, and then one day, after I'd grown up, I suddenly realized that it couldn't have been any simpler.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: —Of course, my father didn't want to take over, and my grandfather never thought of him as a successor.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: He's always called me the heir to the Schwires. Maybe that's his honest belief, but looking back...
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: He was probably just thinking something like: 'As long it's not me, it doesn't matter who it is.'
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: At the time, I still trusted my father, though. Or maybe I should say... even if they have their doubts, there aren't a lot of kids out there who don't trust their parents.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: I was scared. I kept hoping I could avoid becoming the heir.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: So that's why...
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: I still remember the time we first met.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Ha... That's another one of my childhood traumas.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: How's Father? Is he well?
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: I'm afraid... Mr. Schwire's outlook isn't very optimistic.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Master Wei, I didn't expect you to visit today... To what do we owe the pleasure?
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: My old friend is sick, so I'm here to visit. Doctor, please continue.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: His current situation isn't life threatening, but I'm afraid it'll be difficult for him to ever leave his bed again.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Pfffheh.
attributes.name: Young Swire

attributes.content: Beatrix? What's so funny?!
attributes.name: Uncle

attributes.content: This... This is unbelievable!
attributes.name: Aunt

attributes.content: Sorry... Beatrix, apologize! I'm sorry, Master Wei for my daughter's behavior... Beatrix!
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: (Quietly) Hoh...
attributes.name: Adams Swire

attributes.content: Father, you're awake?!
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: (Quietly) My unseemly granddaughter... She's a brave one, but she doesn't mince words.
attributes.name: Adams Swire

attributes.content: Looking back, that was the only praise I ever got from my grandfather. At the time, I didn't even realize what he meant by it. I could only feel... chills, running down my spine.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: I've heard your family still ostracizes you because of that.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Right, they always say I'm an ungrateful, unfilial daughter. Not that I can really disagree with them.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: I guess Grandfather probably didn't mind that I was looking forward to his death, though. He just thought the way I couldn't hold back my laugh was unreasonable and could put him in a difficult position.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: —I was only twelve! Did he really expect me to hide my feelings about everything?!
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: You're beginning to put yourself in his shoes.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Yes, you're right. I had a terrible time after that. Every so often, someone would bring it up.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: A year or two later, though, I suddenly realized something.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: By then, my grandfather was already pretty quiet on his sickbed... He wasn't even awake much, actually. Nevertheless, I still lived in his shadow.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Actually, even before that, I rarely saw him actually giving orders.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: So how did he cast that shadow anyway? Did it come from my grandfather? From my father, my relatives? Or was it actually cast... by my own heart?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: He barely said a word the year after he was bedridden. How come nobody dared to stand up against him? He didn't actually hold much power, but no one resisted him. Why?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Forgive me, Officer Swire... but you don't seem like the type to ponder these matters at age thirteen or so.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Alright, alright! I'm just organizing all the doubts I had at the time! I'm looking back with the wisdom of age, okay?!
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: To tell you the truth, I was only muddling along back then. I didn't think, much less notice what was really on my mind.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: If it wasn't for the cop who saved me, my guess is I would probably be just another loafing, good-for-nothing rich kid.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: I still have the badge he dropped during the kidnapping case. If I ever find him, I'd really like to give him a proper thank you...
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: If you ask me, becoming a superintendent is the best way to show your appreciation.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: I suppose so.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Anyway, I went to Victoria for school, basically because I was trying to get away from Lungmen.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: I thought that, by going to Victoria, I could finally escape my grandfather's shadow. Boy, was I wrong.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: I should've known... The Schwires have far more assets in Victoria than Lungmen.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Those businesses in Victoria had long tried to shake off Adams's control, even before then.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Right, that's why, by going to Victoria, I actually managed to suss out my grandfather's position a little. It was like I finally found some of the answers to all the doubts that had been lingering in my mind.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: I guess... there are a lot of ways to grasp power, but there is only one way to maintain that power, and that's to be right.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: My grandfather could buy dignity with his power, but when he lost the ability to use that power, no one dared to turn on him, and there's only one reason why that is: He's always right.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Officer Swire, I thought you were here to swear your allegiance, until you said that.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: And that's exactly why I am here! Are him being right and me opposing him somehow mutually exclusive?!
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Oh? So you'll betray your family?
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Master Wei! Please, enough teasing already!
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: —I am absolutely not teasing.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: My grandfather has done a lot right, there's no arguing that. But sometimes, there's more than one 'right' in this world.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: What's right for the Schwires isn't necessarily what's right for Lungmen, what was right before isn't necessarily the right way forward, and what used to be right for my grandfather definitely isn't going to be right for me.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: The thought of betraying my family has never crossed my mind. And the idea of betraying Lungmen is even crazier, because I won't ever betray my badge.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: That's my answer, Master Wei. I'll leave it there for now.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Heh... You can keep going.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Where was I...?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Oh, I learned a little about my family's past during secondary school, and that was when I realized how my grandfather had planned everything so carefully when he moved the family business out of Victoria.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: He predicted Victoria's troubles and fissures over forty years ago. He knew Victoria's fall was coming even at the height of its prosperity.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: And then, even though nobody understood his decision, he stubbornly pressed forward until history finally proved him right.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: And also... fine, I'll stop singing his praises. I'm sure you know more about his exploits than I do anyway.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Anyway, I'd be lying if I said I never wavered during this whole process. Though I came to understand that all this... didn't actually make me fear him any more.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: In fact, the more I learned about his achievements... the weaker my fear became.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: All because I couldn't figure out the source of my fear.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Back when I didn't understand anything, my grandfather cast a dark shadow, shrouding even the sky itself. The depth of his terror was limited only by my imagination.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: But when I finally understood the source of his power, he was only as terrifying as the bounds of reality. I know why there is no standing up to him, and that's how...
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: That's how I figured out how to stand up to him.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: And that's that... but I didn't actually mean to backstab anyone, you know?!
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: They call me 'unseemly' day in and day out, like everything I do is some kind of dig at them. What's that about?!
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: That hotheadedness runs in your family. Surely you know that?
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Of course I do, and that just makes me all the more pissed! Why do I have to take over the family business and have them prickling at me day after day? What's wrong with the L.G.D.?!
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: I've long heard rumors of the L.G.D. Officer Swire with her booming voice that echoes loud and clear. It seems the rumors are true.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Ahem. Anyway, I figured at the time... running away won't solve anything.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: If I kept running away, then even if I managed to become a cop, I might still shudder in fear every time my thoughts turned to my grandfather.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: What's more, he'd see me running. And that would only lend more credence to his idea that I'm an unseemly granddaughter.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: No, thank you.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: And that is why, starting your third year of university, you began to take on work in the family business—even if it was in direct opposition to your parents' wishes.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Right... Now that you mention it, they grumbled about that for quite a long while. No matter. Who cares what they think?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Hmm...
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: In 1092, the Schwire Group's Lungmen headquarters issued an order to its real estate officer in northern Victoria to sell off some of their properties there.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: The director refused the order and submitted a report describing why the order was not feasible.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Working through a classmate, you got your hands on certain internal data from the dukedom in question and pointed out errors in the report. That was the first time you meddled in your family's business.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: However, the officer very quickly submitted a second report and plugged all the holes you found.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: In the end, the plan to sell off the properties did not succeed.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: In 1094, you came back to Lungmen, and while you were interning at one of your family's companies, you found out a director trying to get the Corporate Union and Lungmen to turn on each other.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: And you picked a fight during a meeting.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: In the end, the director's plan was foiled, and the individual was relieved of duty. However, you also had to leave the Schwire Group.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: 1095. That was your first year with the L.G.D. The Lungmen Trade Union held a strike over a wage dispute. The Corporate Union asked the L.G.D. to end the strike.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: In private, you arranged for a meeting between the Trade Unionists and the Corporate Union, though it fell apart. You couldn't stop the strike, and you ended up in a huge row with the Commissioner.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Following that, during a Schwire family meeting, your cousin accused you of damaging the Corporate Union's profits, though you fought back, and you did not find yourself more ostracized.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Why are you recounting my life story, Master Wei?! I know I didn't accomplish much during those few years, but growth happens over time!
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Look at how much I've done lately!
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: I'm not trying to make fun of you, Officer Swire.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Do you remember what you said earlier? You asked me what more I expect from you.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: You're wrong to question yourself. This is what I expect to see in you. What the L.G.D. looks to uphold is not justice.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: You've been working to accomplish everything I want out of the L.G.D. You will experience even more failures than you did those few years, but just as you've never given up before, you won't give up now.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Understood.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Master Wei... I'm just thinking... whether I can accomplish the task at hand isn't actually that important.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: What matters is this is the only way I can find courage, and win the right to choose my own path.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: I think I have a pretty good idea of what my grandfather thinks of me being a cop—'You don't have what it takes to devour the L.G.D., so why are you even doing this?'
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: —Maybe something like that? I don't really care anymore, though... Definitely. I don't care. Who cares what he thinks?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: You don't care? How did you manage such a flawless impression him, though?
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Oh... I mean, I've been fixated on this since I was a kid. I can't completely not care!
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: I'm sure you can tell. In recounting my childhood to you, I'm pledging my loyalty.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: But now I know. You've seen what I've done these past four years... No, maybe you've been keeping an eye on me since even before that.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: My actions thus far say much more about my position and how I feel than mere words. And when I say that, I guess it makes this conversation seem kind of meaningless.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Not necessarily... It's true that I used to see Adams in you.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Not that you look anything like him.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Hmm... Actually, even now, I can't say for sure he never influenced me. After all, I know in my heart that I actually do care what he thinks.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: That said... Master Wei, are you willing to have a little faith in me?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Hmm...
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: It's just as you said. Actions speak louder than words.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Well, then... You won't be disappointed.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Hey, I heard the news. Congratulations on your promotion, Missy.
attributes.name: Hoshiguma

attributes.content: Congrats! Dinner's on you tonight, Missy!
attributes.name: L.G.D. Officer A

attributes.content: Fine, whatever! What happened to all your cases? What are you all faffing about for? Get back to work!
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: No way, Missy! Not even officially on the job yet, and you're already terrorizing us with your newfound power?
attributes.name: L.G.D. Officer B

attributes.content: Enough with the glib tongue! To your cases! Everything's on me tonight!
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.text: It's true. I'm not sure whether my grandfather's shadow is still influencing my decisions.

Sometimes, I manage to break free. Other times, I'm pulled back toward him. Resistance is a different, vicious cycle. Standing up to my fears is not an insult to him. It's a means to forget—though I will never forget my grandfather's gaze or his will.
Even so, I'm confident I can find my own way forward.
After all, even if I never shake free of his influence, the warmth this badge brings me has nothing to do with him. My colleagues' laughter has nothing to do with him.
—Lungmen's future has nothing to do with him.
